org.timepedia.chronoscope.client
Interface XYPlot<T extends Tuple2D>

All Superinterfaces:
org.timepedia.exporter.client.Exportable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultXYPlot
public interface XYPlot<T extends Tuple2D>
extends org.timepedia.exporter.client.Exportable

An interface to be implemented by classes implementing XY plots of Dataset objects.

Conceptually, an XYPlot is a class responsible for maintaining a collection of datasets, axes, and graph state, and mapping data-space values to screen-space values suitable for rendering on a View. More specifically, a plot converts data-space values to user-space values by delegating to an Axis implementation.

User-space values are in the interval [0,1] independent of the screen space size of the plot. For example, a ValueAxis with a visible range of 0.0 to 500.0, will map a data-value of 250.0 to a user-space value of 0.5. A renderer like XYLineRenderer or XYBarRenderer will convert user-space values to screen-space values before rendering. When Chronoscope has CategoryPlot support, then a CategoryAxis would map x-axis values like "Groceries", "Gas", "Utilities" to appropriate user-space values (say, 0, 0.5, 1.0)

An important feature of Chronoscope is support for large dataset scalability. This is achieved using datasets with multiresolution representation. At coarser levels of detail, a dataset may be decimated, interpolated, or filtered in a myriad of ways to compress its size, while hopefully preserving as much signal as possible.

A plot maintains some of the following important values:

  • Domain origin
  • Visible Domain
  • Focus point and dataset
  • Hover point and dataset
  • Current highlight/selection

... as well as some stylistic overrides:

  • Legend enabled/disabled
  • Domain axis rendering enabled/disabled
  • Overview enabled/disabled
  • Selection mode on/off

               double destCurrentDomain,
               PlotMovedEvent.MoveType eventType,
               PortableTimerTask continuation)
Animate the domainOrgigin and currentDomain values interpolating to the destination values. This version executes the continuation when the animation finishes.

Parameters:
eventType - hint to specify what kind of UI event this animation corresponds to (ZOOM, SCROLL, ETC)
continuation - executed when animation finishes

calcDisplayY

double calcDisplayY(int datasetIdx,
                    int pointIdx,
                    int dimension)
Returns the Y value (i.e. the range of a 2-tuple datapoint) that should be displayed to the user. Typically, this value will correspond to the actual Y value in the Dataset, however, this value can sometimes represent a transformation of the raw Y value (e.g. a percentage change from some point in time, or a logarithmic scale).

click

boolean click(int x,
              int y)
Process a click on the Plot window given the screen space coordinates, returns true if the click succeeded (e.g. it 'hit' something)

getHoverPoints

int[] getHoverPoints()
Returns an array of data point indices, which element k corresponds to the data point being hovered on in dataset k. A value of -1 indicates that no point in dataset [k] is currently being hovered. The length of the array is equal to the number of datasets in getDatasets()

getSelectionEnd

double getSelectionEnd()
Get the domain value of the end of the current selection

getVisibleDomainMax

double getVisibleDomainMax()
The maximum visible domain value over all datasets taking into account multiresolution representations. This value will differ from Datasets.getDomainExtrema() end value, if the zoomed out view of the Plot forces the renderer to use a coarser representation that may have different values. This can happen if dataset values in higher levels use interpolation rather than point sampling, for example.

getWidestDomain

Interval getWidestDomain()
Returns the widest possible domain for this plot, which corresponds to "max zoom out".

pageLeft

void pageLeft(double pageSize)
Animated pan to the left the designated percentage of this plot's visible domain. For example, 0.5 will move the domain origin by visibleDomain * 0.5.

Parameters:
pageSize - - A value in the range (0.0, 1.0)

pageRight

void pageRight(double pageSize)
Animated pan to the right the designated percentage of this plot's visible domain. For example, 0.5 will move the domain origin by visibleDomain * 0.5.

Parameters:
pageSize - - A value in the range (0.0, 1.0)

setMultiaxis

void setMultiaxis(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables multi-axis mode. True by default, if multi-axis is disabled, each chart effectively has a single RangeAxis which is toggled by which dataset is currently in focus.

Parameters:
enabled - true by default
